article.heading: Geography
article.paragraph: The territory includesconvert155.4km21onAshmore Reef (including West, Middle, andEast Island (Ashmore and Cartier Islands)EastIslands, and twolagoonswithin the reef) andconvert44km20onCartier Reef (includingCartier IslandsCartier Island).citation neededAn Australian Government page cited suggests Ashmore Reef is 239 sq km.April 2014They have a total ofconvert74.1km0onof shoreline, measured along the outer edge of thereef.clarifyWhich reef? Citation? CIA World Fact Book uses that figure, but does not say how measured.April 2014There are no ports or harbours, only offshore anchorage.

West, Middle, and East Islands have a combined land area variously reported as 54 ha, 93 ha, and 112 ha (1hectareis 0.01 km2, or about 2.5acres).cite journalCarterMikeClarkeRohanPierceFrankDooleySeanSwannGeorgeGrantMurrayLesser Coucal 'Centropus bengalensis' on Ashmore Reef: First Record for Australia1448-0107Australian Field Ornithology2732010Within the reef are three small islands: West, Middle and east Islands (total land area 54 ha). The largest and most heavily vegetated is West Island...cite webDepartment of Sustainability, Environment, Water, Population and Communities, Australian GovernmentAshmore Reef National Nature Reserve and Cartier Island Marine ReserveMarine Protected Areashttp://www.environment.gov.au/coasts/mpa/ashmore/https://web.archive.org/web/20110709123527/http://www.environment.gov.au/coasts/mpa/ashmore/2011-07-09Cartier Island is an unvegetated sand island, with a reported land area of 0.4 ha.cite bookTaylor & Francis GroupThe Europa World Year Book 2004http://books.google.com/books?id45th2004Europa Publications, Taylor & Francis Group978-1-85743-254-1611

Ashmore Reef is calledPulau Pasirby Indonesians. In theRote Islandlanguage, it is calledNusa Solokaek. Both names have the meaning "Sand Island".cite webhttp://rspas.anu.edu.au/people/personal/foxxj_rspas/Fishermen_MOU_BOX.pdfhttp://web.archive.org/web/20060827142957/http://rspas.anu.edu.au/people/personal/foxxj_rspas/Fishermen_MOU_BOX.pdf2006-08-27A STUDY OF SOCIO-ECONOMIC ISSUES FACING TRADITIONAL INDONESIAN FISHERS WHO ACCESS THE MOU BOX

Nearby Hibernia Reef,convert42km0onnortheast of Ashmore Reef, is not part of the territory, but rather belongs to Western Australia.States of AustraliaRetrieved 2011-06-23It has no permanently dry land area, although large parts of the reef become exposed during low tide.
article.heading: Government
article.paragraph: The territory is administered fromCanberraby the Department of Regional Australia, Local Government, Arts and Sport, which is also responsible for the administration of the territories ofChristmas Island,Cocos (Keeling) Islands, theCoral Sea Islands,Jervis Bay TerritoryandNorfolk Island.cite webAssistant Director, Territories and Disaster Reconstruction DivisionTerritories of Australiahttp://www.regional.gov.au/territoriesDepartment of Regional Australia, Local Government, Arts and Sport16 June 20127 February 2008http://web.archive.org/web/20080206093322/http://www.regional.gov.au/territories6 February 2008noAs part of the Machinery of Government Changes following the 2010 Federal Election, administrative responsibility for Territories was transferred from the Attorney General's Department to the Department of Regional Australia, Local Government, Arts and Sport. Defence of Ashmore and Cartier Islands is the responsibility of Australia, with periodic visits by theRoyal Australian Navy,Royal Australian Air ForceandAustralian Customs and Border Protection Service. The vesselACV Ashmore GuardianACV ''Ashmore Guardian''is stationed more-or-less permanently off the reef. The islands are also visited by seasonal caretakers and occasional scientific researchers.

On 21 October 2002 the nature reserve was recognised as a wetland of international importance when it was designated Ramsar Site 1220 under theRamsar ConventionRamsar Convention on Wetlands.Annotated Ramsar List.

Due to its proximity to Indonesia, and the area being traditional fishing grounds of Indonesian fishermen for centuries, some Indonesian groups claims Ashmore Reef to be part ofRote Ndao RegencyofEast Nusa Tenggaraprovince. However, the Indonesian government does not appear to actively contest Australia's possession of the territory. Australia's sovereignty is backed up by the fact that the territory was not administered by theNetherlands(Indonesia's former colonial power), but by theUnited KingdomBritishbefore it was transferred to Australia.

A memorandum of understanding between the Australian and Indonesian governments allows Indonesian fishermen access to their traditional fishing grounds within the regionspecial purpose visawithout any formal visa arrangements, subject to limits.

article.heading: Ashmore Reef Commonwealth Marine Reserve
article.paragraph: File:Cartier Island.pngthumbrightCartier Island and surrounding reef (NASAsatellite image)The Ashmore Reef Commonwealth Marine Reserve (formerly Ashmore Reef National Nature Reserve), established in August 1983, comprises an area of approximatelyconvert583km20on.cite webhttp://laptop.deh.gov.au/marinereserves/north-west/ashmore/index.html2014-04-142013-06-17Commonwealth Marine ReservesDepartment of the Environment, Australian GovernmentAshmore Reef Commonwealth Marine ReserveIt is of significantbiodiversityvalue as it is in the flow of theIndonesian Throughflowocean current from the Pacific Ocean throughMaritime Southeast Asiato the Indian Ocean.citation neededAugust 2013It is also in a surface current west from theArafura SeaandTimor Sea.

The Reserve comprises several marine habitats, including seagrass meadows, intertidal sand flats, coral reef flats, and lagoons, and supports an important and diverse range of species, including 14 species ofsea snakes, a population ofdugongthat may be genetically distinct, a diversemarine invertebratefauna, and manyendemismendemicspecies, especially of sea snakes andmolluscs. There are feeding and nesting sites forLoggerhead Turtleloggerhead,Hawksbill turtlehawksbillandgreen turtles. It is classified as anImportant Bird Areaand has 50,000 breeding pairs of various kinds ofseabirds. A high abundance and diversity ofsea cucumbers,over-exploitationover-exploitedon other reefs in the region, is present, with 45 species recorded.
article.heading: Cartier Island Commonwealth Marine Reserve
article.paragraph: The Cartier Island Commonwealth Marine Reserve (formerly Cartier Island Marine Reserve), established in June 2000, comprises an area of approximatelyconvert172km20on, within a 4 nautical mile radius from the center of Cartier Island, and extends to a depth ofconvert1km1onbelow the sea floor.cite webhttp://laptop.deh.gov.au/marinereserves/north-west/cartier/index.html2014-04-142013-06-17Commonwealth Marine ReservesDepartment of the Environment, Australian GovernmentCartier Island Commonwealth Marine ReserveIt includes the reef around Cartier island, a small submerged pinaccle called Wave Governor Bank, and two shallow pools to the island's northeast.
article.heading: Economy and migration
article.paragraph: There is no economic activity in the Territory. As Ashmore Reef is the closest point of Australian territory to Indonesia, it was a popular target forpeople smugglerstransportingasylum seekersto AustraliaAnita Roberts"Don't let them drown"Inside IndonesiaAprJun 2001, vol. 64despite its onlywater wellwellsbeing infected withcholeraor contaminated andpotable waterundrinkable.Bizarre Happenings at Reef,Royal Australian NavyNews, 28 June 1999, accessed 29 July 2010Once they had landed on Ashmore, asylum seekers could claim to have entered Australian territory and request to be processed as refugees. The use of Ashmore for this purpose created great notoriety during late 2001, when refugee arrivals became a major political issue in Australia. As Australia was not the country of first asylum for these "boat people", the Australian Government did not consider that it had a responsibility to accept them.

A number of things were done to discourage the practice such as attempting to have the people smugglers arrested in Indonesia; the so-calledPacific Solutionof processing them in third countries; the boarding and forced turnaround of the boats by Australian military forces, and finally excising Ashmore and many other small islands from theAustralian migration zone. Two boatloads of asylum seekers were each detained for several days in the lagoon at Ashmore after failed attempts by theRoyal Australian Navyto turn them back to Indonesia in October 2001.
